message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.SI, cs.CL. 

The paper proposes a graph filtering framework for semi-supervised learning, which is a common topic in machine learning and artificial intelligence (cs.LG, cs.AI). The proposed framework is applied to various classification tasks, including citation networks and knowledge graphs, which are common in natural language processing and information retrieval (cs.CV, cs.CL). The paper also mentions a semi-supervised regression task for zero-shot image recognition, which falls under computer vision (cs.CV). Finally, the paper discusses the modeling capabilities and complexity of label propagation and graph convolutional networks, which are relevant to signal processing and systems and control (cs.SI).
